title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**Date:** 1 Sept 2025
  
  
**Location:**  
Melbourne, VIC, AU
  
  
**Department:** Audit and Assurance
  
  
**Description:**  
**Job Requisition ID:** 39284
  
  
Work in a start-up like environment – opportunity to develop new features
  
Holistic well-being program – flu vaccinations and health & wellbeing focused work
  
We support flexibility and choice. We encourage you to find the right balance between connecting in person with your clients and teams and meeting your own personal needs
  
  
About our team & our platform
  
  
The Audit & Assurance (A&A) Data & Digital team is at the heart of the Asset Transformation Strategy across Deloitte Asia Pacific. With a unique blend of data technologists, designers, developers, and management consultants, we are a powerhouse committed to delivering next generation solutions to all A&A clients through our proprietary Big Data Platform. Our platform serves thousands of clients, engagements and users, it processes billions or records across hundreds of solutions both in Australia and Asia Pacific.
  
  
What will your typical day look like?
  
  
We are looking for an innovative and passionate AI-native software engineer to lead the engineer team to design, build and optimise our data and AI platform. You will apply structured problem solving, effective time management, and provide junior team members with support and guidance needed to deliver high quality outcomes. The role involves:
  
  
Lead end-to-end solution development from ideas to production scale
  
Embed AI-assisted framework to design, build, and optimise our cloud data platform, including new UI components, APIs, data pipelines, and AI/ML integrations
  
Collaborate with the data and AI team to integrate rules engines, ML models, and reporting/visualisation layers (data lake, pipelines, dashboards)
  
Contribute to feature pipeline planning and influence the strategic direction of the platform
  
Champion agentic development patterns to enable scalable automation and integration
  
Mentor and guide junior engineers in software development, coding standards, and best practices, including code reviews
  
  
Enough about us, let's talk about you. You’re someone with…
  
  
4+ years of relevant work experience as a Full Stack Software Engineer
  
Proficiency in .NET Core APIs, C#, and HTML/CSS/JavaScript and ReactJS (or Angular)
  
Strong technical abilities to design solutions, write and debug complex code (including APIs), and apply best practices in software engineering
  
Experience with relational databases and handling large data volumes with Python and SQL
  
Proven experience using AI-powered developer tools (e.g. GitHub Copilot, Claude Code, Model Context Protocol (MCP), or similar) as a core part of your engineering workflow, from coding and testing to documentation and automation
  
Familiarity with modern development practices, including code control, CI/CD pipelines, TDD/BDD
  
  
**Exposure to the following would be advantageous:**  
Cloud technologies (Azure preferred), Docker, Kubernetes and open-source data/platform engineering tools
  
Data visualisation and analytical platforms (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Databricks)
  
Commercial awareness with an ability to think strategically in the delivery of cloud-based solutions
  
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with proven ability to work effectively with diverse, multidisciplinary teams
  
**Self-starter mindset:** comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced, flexible, and dynamic environment
  
  
Why Deloitte?
  
  
At Deloitte, we focus our energy on interesting and impactful work. We’re always learning, innovating and setting the standard; making a positive difference to our clients and our society. We put coaching at the heart of what we do, helping our people grow their careers in any direction – whether it be up, moving into something new, or even moving across the world.
  
  
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion. We have a diverse collection of people from different backgrounds, with different experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. What binds us together is a shared commitment to value everyone’s perspective and to cultivate inclusion; so that our work environment is a safe space we can all belong.
  
  
We support flexibility and choice. We encourage you to find the right balance between connecting in person with your clients and teams and meeting your own personal needs.
  
  
We help you live and work well. To support your personal and professional life, we offer a range of perks and benefits, including retail discounts, wellbeing leave, paid volunteering days, twelve flexible working options, market-leading parental leave and return to work support package.

title: Senior Product Manager - Programmatic SEO
description:
**Job Description**

**Join the team redefining how the world experiences design.**

Hey, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora, 你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point.

**Where and how you can work**

Our flagship campus is in Sydney. We also have a campus in Melbourne and co-working spaces in Brisbane, Perth and Adelaide. But you have choice in where and how you work, we trust our Canvanauts to choose the balance that empowers them and their team to achieve their goals.

**About the role**

This is **not** a SEO marketing role.

The Programmatic SEO (PSEO) Product Manager will lead **product strategy** and delivery for our programmatic SEO Insights Service – a system designed to drive scalable growth through automation, advanced insights, and experimentation. This includes shaping capabilities for large-scale content and page generation, discovery of high-value opportunities, and enabling global expansion at speed - across 40+ languages.

* Lead programmatic SEO strategy and execution for some of Canva’s most important logged-out growth surfaces, ensuring these areas continue to scale sustainably and drive measurable impact.
* Accelerate large-scale page launches and identify opportunities to expand into new high-value markets, topics, and content categories.
* Scale and prioritise automation systems that power programmatic SEO, enabling smaller organic growth teams to achieve disproportionately large results.
* Collaborate closely across functions including SEO, engineering, content, platform infrastructure, marketplace, and product surface teams to deliver aligned, high-quality outputs.
* Advance AI-driven content workflows to improve efficiency, quality, and experimentation velocity in programmatic SEO.
* Strengthen international growth capabilities by ensuring automation systems can support localisation and market-specific needs at scale.

**You're probably a match if**

* You’re a **Senior Product Manager** with experience in infra, ML platforms, and with a strong systems-level thinking.
* You have deep curiosity about experimentation, automation, and search trends.
* You don’t need to be an SEO expert – we have that covered – but must know how to lead complex workflows across Machine Learning/Engineering/SEO/Content.
* You are analytical and love diving into data (Bonus: familiarity with SEO tools and platforms)
* You thrive on collaborating with cross-functional and international stakeholders
* You have prior experience in process mapping and optimization
* You have a persistent desire to leverage automation and machine learning to do things more efficiently
* You have a growth mindset and value detail as much as the big picture. You thrive in a collaborative fast-paced environment, working together with a diverse set of stakeholders from SEO to Design, Marketing and Engineering, to figure out how we can multiply the impact of every organic growth strategy across surfaces and end to end user funnels.
* You consider yourself a strong all-rounder; data, research, strategy, product mock-ups - whatever it's, you can comfortably wear the hat

**About the Product team**

The mission of Product Managers at Canva is to create the most accessible design tool for every person in the world. We believe that we can improve the world by empowering everyone to design and communicate visually. As a Product Manager at Canva you help set this vision, define what that future looks like, and build the products that get us there.

Product Managers collaborate with Canva’s founders to set the strategic direction, scope, and success metrics for product initiatives. We work across teams of designers, software engineers, marketers and analysts to ensure we're delivering an exceptional experience to all our users. We are responsible for implementing and collaborating on product strategy, roadmapping, and prioritisation as our product grows. It’s our responsibility to see products through their entire lifecycle—from concept through to validation, build, post-launch analytics and iterations.

**About the Logged Out Experience group**

The Logged Out Experience Group sits within Growth. Our mission is to empower every user in the world to discover Canva. We are responsible for organic acquisition and retention, and work collaboratively across the company to supercharge growth for our products and drive initial and cross product adoption. We’ve achieved great success with driving over 30M new active users in just the last year, but we are only getting started.

**What's in it for you?**

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you'll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a range of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

Here's a taste of what's on offer:

* Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too
* Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers
* An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more
* Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

**Other stuff to know**

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

We celebrate all types of skills and backgrounds at Canva so even if you don’t feel like your skills quite match what’s listed above - we still want to hear from you!

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

title: Full Stack Engineer (AU)
description:
Work with cutting edge technology, making the world a safer and more secure place. DroneShield (ASX:DRO) offers an opportunity to solve some of the world’s most challenging technical problems in Electronic Warfare, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, RF sensing, Sensor Fusion and distributed systems. Working with high profile customers across militaries, government agencies, airports, critical infrastructure, law enforcement and many others.

With one of the largest listed defence company market capitalisations in Australia and having raised approximately $250m in 2024 alone, DroneShield is undergoing hypergrowth stage, fuelled by rapidly increasing use of drones for nefarious applications, from battlefield, to terrorism, to contraband delivery and commercial espionage.

This role is in the DroneShield Sydney headquarters in Sydney CBD. There are approximately 320 staff based in the 4,000sqm facility today, scheduled to grow to approximately 400 staff by end of 2025. Overseas on the ground presence includes USA, Denmark, Mexico, and UAE, as well as distributors in over 70 countries globally.

**About the role**

We’re looking for a Full Stack Engineer with Go backend experience and strong frontend skills to help build internal tools for annotation workflows, device monitoring, and AI operations. You’ll work across the stack — building APIs, crafting responsive user interfaces, and integrating real-time data and telemetry. Your work will directly impact our annotation teams, AI engineers, and field-deployed systems.

You will be part of the **AI Systems team**, focused on increasing ML tooling capability, ML and data integrations, operational efficiency, automation, and observability across our AI teams and capabilities platform.

**Responsibilities, Duties and Expectations**

* Build and maintain full stack applications to support annotation tooling capability, ML workflow automation, and global device telemetry
* Develop backend APIs and services in Go to support frontend applications and data tools
* Build intuitive and responsive user interfaces using modern web frameworks
* Collaborate with AI and RFAI teams to surface logs, model state, and sensor metadata in real time
* Contribute to internal developer tools that support data ingestion, search, versioning, and monitoring
* Ensure high code quality, maintainability, and documentation across the stack

**Qualifications, Experience and Skills**

* Proven experience in Go (Golang) backend development
* Proficiency with modern frontend frameworks (React, Vue, or similar)
* Experience building and integrating APIs, including WebSocket or streaming endpoints
* Comfortable working across the stack, from backend services and DBs to UI/UX design
* Familiarity with structured logging, observability tools, and frontend performance optimisation
* Bonus: Experience with annotation platforms, real-time dashboards, or developer tooling

*Note for recruitment agencies: We do not accept unsolicited candidates from external recruiters unless specifically instructed.*

company: Telstra Business Technology Centre Perth South
description:
**Employment Type**
-------------------

Permanent

**Closing Date**
----------------

15 Sept 2025 11:59pm

**Job Title**
-------------

Digital Intelligence Senior Specialist

**Job Summary**

**Job Description**
-------------------

**Focus of the role**

This role is a strategic and hands-on leadership position focused on driving innovation and operational excellence across Telstra’s digital ecosystem. The Senior Digital Intelligence Specialist will shape the evolution of digital identity, AI/ML model lifecycle, experimentation frameworks, and search strategies to deliver hyper-personalised, data-driven customer experiences.

**About the role**

We are seeking a visionary and technically proficient senior specialist with a passion for emerging technologies to spearhead the strategic evolution and operational excellence of our Digital Profile, AI/ML model lifecycle, Experimentation frameworks, and Search (SEO/SEM) Strategy. This role is instrumental in redefining how we understand, engage, and serve our customers by leveraging data-driven personalisation, and continuous innovation.

As a **Digital Intelligence Senior Specialist** , you will shape the design, deployment, and governance of AI/ML models, oversee the digital identity ecosystem as it relates to our known and unknown visitor personalisation efforts, and lead experimentation initiatives that drive customer-centric transformation across our digital and search channels. You will identify opportunities to develop, execute, and optimise personalised experiences across Telstra’s digital assets (web and app), with the goal of enhancing customer engagement, accelerating digital sales, and expanding self-service capabilities.

The role demands a hybrid expert with deep technical acumen, strategic foresight, and the ability to influence cross-functional teams. Success requires fluency in CDPs, personalisation platforms, AI/ML tools, and experimentation methodologies, along with a strong grasp of data privacy and ethical AI practices.

As a Senior Digital Intelligence Specialist, you will be a key hybrid expert within our COE, deploying your diverse skills across the digital landscape to solve our most pressing business challenges. Your focus will be dynamic, shifting quarterly to drive impact where it's needed most, from pioneering AI-driven personalisation initiatives to optimising our search strategy to leading high-impact experimentation initiatives.

**Key Responsibilities**

**Digital Profile**

* Define and evolve the architecture and governance of the known and unknown digital visitor profile across
* platforms.
* Ensure seamless integration of identity, behavioural, and contextual data to enable hyper-personalisation.
* Leverage DMP’s and CDP’s (e.g., Adobe, Braze, Salesforce) and AI-driven machine learning tools to refine audience strategies and improve campaign performance.
* Collaborate with privacy, security, and compliance teams to uphold data ethics and regulatory standards.

**AI Models & Machine Learning**

* Identify and implement opportunities to leverage AI/ML. This could range from developing predictive models for customer behaviour to deploying machine learning for campaign automation and personalisation at scale.
* Partner with data scientists, engineers, analysts and product teams to embed intelligent capabilities into digital experiences.
* Champion model performance, fairness, explainability, and continuous improvement

**Experimentation and Optimisation**

* Lead the end-to-end CRO and personalisation lifecycle, from hypothesis generation and statistical analysis to experiment design and implementation to drive significant uplifts in user experience and conversion.
* Drive a culture of test-and-learn to validate hypotheses, optimise user journeys, and accelerate innovation.
* Translate insights into actionable strategies that enhance customer engagement and business outcomes.
* Strategies to enhance the visibility and effectiveness of AI-driven digital initiatives (including impacts to Search).

**Integrated Digital Strategy**

* Align experimentation, audience management, and search strategies with overarching digital channel objectives, ensuring cohesive and integrated digital marketing efforts.
* Effectively communicate complex programs to a diverse audience to secure endorsement and commitment.
* Maintain knowledge of digital trends and customer preferences through active thought leadership and share expertise with team members to inform digital strategies and channels that deliver optimal experiences.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure Search insights inform personalisation, experimentation, and content strategies.

**About you**

To be successful in the role, you must have:

**Key Behaviours:**

* Curious Mindset: Demonstrates a relentless curiosity and eagerness to explore new technologies and methodologies, always seeking to understand and leverage the latest advancements.
* Visionary Thinking: Possesses the ability to envision and articulate a forward-thinking strategy that aligns with the evolving digital landscape.
* Technical Proficiency: Demonstrates knowledge in emerging technologies and facilitates the
* implementation of discovery.
* Collaborative Leadership: Fosters a collaborative environment, working closely with cross-functional teams and leadership to drive strategic initiatives and achieve shared goals.
* Customer-Centric Approach: Prioritises the customer experience, using data-driven insights to deliver personalised and impactful digital interactions.
* Ways of Working. Ensure that our approach to digital innovation and customer engagement remains agile, forward-thinking, and aligned with ways of working.
* Resilient, flexible and agile. In a forever changing environment, be able to adjust to change and assess impacts.

**Essential**

* Proven experience in digital transformation, data science, or AI leadership roles—ideally within telecommunications or technology sectors.
* Strategic mindset with a hands-on approach to innovation, delivery, and problem-solving.
* Deep expertise in digital profile and identity management to enable personalisation at scale.
* Hands-on experience with Customer Data Platforms (CDPs), Personalisation Engines, and Digital Identity Frameworks.
* Strong background in AI/ML technologies, including model development, governance, and MLOps practices.
* Ability to apply statistical rigour to model evaluation, experimentation, and performance measurement.
* Track record of leading complex experimentation initiatives to validate hypotheses and accelerate learning.
* Proficient with experimentation platforms such as Adobe Target, Braze, and Contentsquare.
* Skilled in A/B and multivariate testing, uplift modelling, and causal inference techniques.
* Experience with Adobe Experience Platform, Braze, and Salesforce Marketing Cloud to drive personalised engagements at scale.
* Proven ability to optimise digital placements for customer engagement, sales conversion, and selfservice.
* Strong command of digital analytics tools, customer segmentation, and behavioural modelling.
* Ability to translate complex data insights into scalable, customer-facing digital solutions.
* Familiarity with modern data stacks and cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, and Azure preferred.
* Understanding of data privacy, security, and ethical AI considerations.
* Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, with the ability to influence at all levels.
* Demonstrated ability to mentor, upskill, and empower teams while maintaining delivery momentum.
* Passion for fostering a culture of innovation, data literacy, and continuous improvement.

title: Staff Engineer
description:
### **We are see****king a Staff Engineer to join our Melbourne team.**

### **The Opportunity: Where Technical Excellence Meets Life-****Changing Impact**

Imagine leading a team that builds technology used by millions of people across 19 countries, processing over $90M in donations annually - all in service of changing the face of men's health. This isn't just another tech lead role; it's a chance to shape how Movember transforms from a campaign powerhouse into a year-round force for good in men's health.

You'll be joining us at an inflection point. We're modernising from a battle-tested monolith to a composable, domain-driven architecture using AWS Lambda and Node.js. We're pioneering AI-augmented development with tools like Claude Code and Windsurf. And we’re doing it all to create a world-class fundraising & community platform.

### **Why This Role Matters**

Every line of code you and your team write, every architectural decision you support, and every developer you mentor directly impacts our ability to fund life-saving health programs. When your team optimises our payment processing by milliseconds,more donations flow to suicide prevention. When your team builds resilient systems, researchers get reliable data for prostate cancer breakthroughs.

This is engineering with purpose.

### **What Makes This Role Unique**

**You're Not Just a Tech Lead** - You're a force multiplier who empowers developers to deliver their best work. You'll balance deep technical expertise with genuine people mentorship, turning good developers into great ones through pair programming, thoughtful code reviews, and creating psychological safety for innovation.

**Campaign Season is Your Team's AFL Grand Final** - Every October through December, our platform experiences massive scale challenges that matches the traffic of large global organisations. Think Black Friday meets social movement. While we've solved the basics, there’re endless opportunities for optimisation and innovation. You'll lead your team through these high-stakes periods with grace, ensuring our global community can fundraise without friction.

**AI is Your Co****-Pilot,** **Not Your Replacement** - We're at the beginning of an exciting AI transformation journey. You'll help shape how we integrate AI into our development processes, from advanced context engineering to MCP servers, making our small team punch well above our weight.

**You Think in Horizons,** **Not Sprints** - While your team delivers value quarterly, you're always thinking 6-12 months ahead. You understand that today's quick fix is tomorrow's technical debt, and you make decisions that balance immediate needs with long-term sustainability.

**Every Day is Different** - One moment you're pair programming with a junior developer, turning bug fixes into teaching moments about distributed systems. The next, you're collaborating with Product and Marketing to translate their vision for personalised donor experiences into technical reality. You'll help architect solutions for payment processing that handle 100x traffic spikes across 19 regulatory environments, then shift to one-on-ones where you help team members navigate the journey from monolithic to business services thinking. In our hybrid work environment, office days buzz with collaborative energy while remote days offer deep focus time.

### **The Technical Playground**

**Core Stack**: Node.js, React, JavaScript, TypeScript, AWS services including Lambda, PHP

title: Systems Architect - Digital Engineering
description:
**Title:**

Systems Architect - Digital Engineering

**About KBR:**

**At KBR – We do things that matter.**

We deliver science, technology and engineering solutions to governments and companies around the world. KBR employs approximately 38,000 people worldwide with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in over 29 countries.

KBR is proud to work with its customers across the globe to provide technology, value-added services, and long-term operations and maintenance services to ensure consistent delivery with predictable results. At KBR, We Deliver.

***Think.KBR.com***

**KBR in Australia**

With over 65 years working on some of Australia’s largest and most complex projects, KBR has unmatched experience supporting the nation’s critical infrastructure, energy transition and national security priorities. KBR has around 2,000 employees throughout Australia, who are focused on delivering innovative technology and engineering solutions for a safer, more secure and sustainable future.

**Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR**

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company. That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

**The Opportunity**

**KBR is driving a Digital Engineering strategy to manage complexity, harness our technical capability, and deliver speed to capability for Defence.** This strategy enables advanced digital environments and facilities to support Defence programs, including the development, hosting, and integration of systems as models, architectures, and digital twins.

As a **Systems Architect**, you will play a pivotal role in both execution and enablement. You’ll work with domain specialists and stakeholders to capture and model concepts, requirements, and designs for major Defence programs such as **C4ISREW, MILSATCOM, Space** and other critical capabilities. Responsibilities include developing and sustaining MBSE architectures using tools like **CATIA Cameo, Enterprise Architect, or ANSYS**, undertaking mission engineering through mission threads and scenarios, and applying modelling and simulation across the lifecycle to ensure traceability from requirements through to verification.

You will also help grow KBR’s Digital Engineering Infrastructure, including the **Systems Integration Laboratory** and collaborative virtual network environments. This involves engaging with clients and stakeholders to mature facilities and capability. Strong technical knowledge of Defence platforms, applications, and systems will be highly valued, alongside an understanding of emerging technologies such as **AI/ML, digital twins, and cloud platforms**.

This role requires collaboration, innovation, and technical leadership to drive growth and capability across KBR’s Australian Defence and Security Solutions business.

**Responsibilities**

The key responsibilities of the role will include, but are not limited to:

* Develop and integrate Mission Engineering Models and Simulations using Model-based Systems Engineering (MBSE) digital modelling and simulation tools in execution of the KBR Digital Engineering Strategy. These activities will be undertaken both during the capture and execution phases.
* Define End to End Architecture solutions aligned to technology standards and roadmaps and strategies in response to business requirements.
* Grow capability enablement maturity through collaboration with the team of the KBR Digital Engineering Project. This may involve input to design of environments, development of models, guidance or reports.
* Analyse and evaluate and if necessary, validate externally sourced models and integrated them into the System or Enterprise framework.
* Enhance KBR Digital Engineering Knowledge Base for execution through delivery of model or environment artefacts, configuration scripts and enhancements to support reuse or adoption.
* Undertake stakeholder engagement and collaboration with defence clients, project teams, and industry partners to define system architecture strategies and technical roadmaps.
* Manage the configuration and databases appropriate for the digital engineering toolchains, including Requirements Management, Windchill PLM, MBSE, simulation, and data analytics platforms.
* Ensure architectural solutions comply with appropriate defence standards (e.g., ASDEFCON, MIL-STD-881, ISO/IEC 15288) and cybersecurity protocols.
* Gather and evaluate user feedback and recommend and execute improvements to models and support changes to environments.
* Analyse interfaces and integrate supplier and customer models into overall system or enterprise frameworks.
* Create technical documentation and deliver reporting on the status and capability of the modelling activity.
* Support the enhancement and deployment of Digital Engineering environment, including infrastructure, applications and services.

**Qualifications, Skills and Experience**

**Essential:**

* BSc/BA in Systems Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field and commensurate certifications with relevant professional body.
* Professional Engineer with 8y+ of experience in digital systems including significant experience of below-the-line digital design and integration.
* Proven experience in development of systems architecture within defence industry , aerospace, or other regulated environments.
* A deep understanding of systems engineering lifecycle and digital engineering concepts.
* Demonstrable experience of *creation* and refinement of a range of digital models and simulation.
* Experience in capturing operational concepts as models and collaborating with stakeholders to obtain inputs and subsequently deliver a high value of information from those models.
* Good understanding of configuration management and baselines in context of managing engineering change.
* Excellent communication skills in presentation and demonstration of digital systems to non-technical stakeholders.
* Experience in mentoring engineering teams in digital engineering systems thinking, model governance , configuration and deployment.
* Knowledge of System Software lifecycle process including phased and a scaled Agile approach.
* Strong proficiency in MBSE methodologies and tools (SysML, UML).
* Proficiency in working with DoDAF, MODAF, or NATO Architecture Framework (NAF).
* Eligibility for Australian Government Security Clearance (NV1 or higher).

**Desirable:**

* A Masters degree in a relevant subject will be valued.
* Professional recognition as CPEng, ACS Member or registered Professional Engineer.
* Experience of leading innovation and managing in uncertainty.
* Experience of maturing new capabilities through People, Process and Tools dimensions.
* Experience is DevOps Agile and/or SAFe frameworks is beneficial, as well as familiarity with popular coding languages (eg. Python, Javascript).
* Ability to work within a complex dynamic technology environment and be comfortable with iterative approaches and challenges of emergent capability.
* Experience with Software and Hardware Integration such as data bus interfaces, real-time processing, and sensor fusion.
* Good understanding of secure, resilient, and interoperable communication systems.
* Knowledge of cyber resilience, threat modeling, and secure systems design is an advantage.
* Experience of Modular Open Systems Approach (MOSA) is an advantage.

**Benefits of KBR**

* A workplace culture certified as a Great Place To Work (Aus, India, UK & US)
* Flexible working conditions
* Competitive salary (including annual reviews)
* Paid Parental leave
* Paid Reservist leave
* Income protection
* Corporate rewards
* Salary packaging/Novated leasing
* Discounted employee stock purchase plans
* Flu shots, skin checks and private health insurance discounts
* Career development: Online learning, mentorship and career pathways

**If you’re ready to shape tomorrow, let’s get started. Apply Now!**

*KBR acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of Country throughout Australia and their continuing connections to land, sea, community and culture. We pay our respects to Elders past and present.*

*As a Major Service Provider of the Australian Defence Force, an AGSVA security clearance will be required and compliance to International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). As such, our hiring decisions are based on the key requirements of each role and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and experiences.*

**Job Description**
-------------------

Zendesk’s people have one goal in mind: to make Customer Experience better. Our products help more than 125,000 global brands (AirBnb, Uber, JetBrains, Slack, among others) make their billions of customers happy, every day.

The AI/ML Platform team is at the forefront of this mission. We build the foundation that powers every AI-driven experience at Zendesk, enabling product teams to build, evaluate, and deploy state-of-the-art Large Language Model (LLM) applications reliably and at scale.

We’re looking for a Prompt Engineer at the ML Engineer II level to design, test, and optimize the prompts, system messages, and evaluation strategies that power Zendesk’s GenAI features. You’ll work closely with applied ML teams, product managers, and researchers to ensure LLM outputs are accurate, safe, and aligned with product goals.

*This is a hands-on, experimentation-heavy role, perfect for someone who blends* *strong ML engineering skills* *with* *deep curiosity about language models* *and a passion for improving AI output quality.*

**What you get to do every day**
--------------------------------

* Create and refine prompts, system messages, and instructions for a variety of LLM-powered Zendesk products.
* Work with ML engineers to design automated and human-in-the-loop evaluation pipelines for prompt performance, accuracy, and safety.
* Run structured experiments to compare prompts, parameter settings, and model variants, using A/B testing and offline benchmarks.
* Adapt prompts for multiple LLM providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Llama) while maintaining consistency in behavior.
* Maintain prompt libraries, guidelines, and best practices to accelerate development across teams.

**What you bring to the role**
------------------------------

* 2–4 years of ML, NLP, or software engineering experience, with exposure to production-grade AI systems.
* Understanding of how prompts, temperature, system instructions, and context windows impact LLM behavior.
* Experience designing or running experiments to assess model output quality, accuracy, and safety.
* Proficiency in Python, with experience in data analysis, scripting, and working with APIs.
* Ability to identify failure cases, debug prompt behavior, and iterate quickly.
* Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and take feedback constructively.

**Preferred Qualifications**
----------------------------

* Experience with prompt engineering or prompt chaining for LLMs.
* Knowledge of few-shot and zero-shot prompt design.
* Familiarity with vector databases , retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and grounding techniques.
* Exposure to agentic frameworks such as LangChain, Haystack, or semantic workflow engines.

* Our code is written in Python.
* Our servers live in AWS.
* LLM Vendors : OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Llama
* Infra: Kubernetes, Docker, Kafka, AWS

* Exciting projects, ability to implement your own ideas and improvements.

* Create mechanisms for effective human-AI collaboration, including clarification, feedback, guidance and follow-up questions
* Optimize agent performance for reliability, accuracy, and efficiency
* Build monitoring and evaluation systems to assess agent performance and identify areas for improvement
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate agents into products and workflows
* Stay updated with the latest research and developments in AI agent technology

### **Requirements**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, AI, or related field
* 10+ years of experience building AI/ML systems, with a proven track of building production-grade AI applications (prefer in autonomous agents)
* Strong programming skills, particularly in Python, Java
* Practical experience with large language models (e.g., GPT, Claude, Gemini, Deepseek), prompt engineering, MCP, RAG etc.
* Understanding of reinforcement learning, planning algorithms, and decision-making systems
* Familiarity with tools, APIs, and infrastructure needed for agent deployment
* Experience with workflow orchestration and system design
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical thinking skills
* Strong communication and collaboration abilities

### **Preferred Skills**

* Conduct at least one AI chatbot/agent application using Dify / LangChain or similar framework
* Experience in CS chatbot development, like user intend recognition, conversation, and knowledge base enhancement
* Familiar with data analysis, model tuning through data cleaning and feature engineering

**Why Binance**

* Shape the future with the world’s leading blockchain ecosystem
* Collaborate with world-class talent in a user-centric global organization with a flat structure
* Tackle unique, fast-paced projects with autonomy in an innovative environment
* Thrive in a results-driven workplace with opportunities for career growth and continuous learning
* Competitive salary and company benefits
